synsets.definition: A state of acute psychological alarm when one's social position or family honor is threatened, triggering defensive responses to protect collective face and harmony
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese concept linking individual alarm to collective social standing and family reputation

synsets.definition: A deep sense of foreboding about disruption to social harmony (wa), manifesting as anticipatory anxiety about potential group discord
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese cultural alarm specifically focused on threats to group cohesion and social balance

synsets.definition: Culturally-specific anxiety arising from perceived threats to filial obligations or ancestral honor, creating deep familial alarm
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept where personal alarm is inseparable from family and ancestral responsibilities

synsets.definition: Acute distress and alarm when facing situations that threaten one's dharmic path or righteous duties, creating spiritual-social anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu concept where alarm stems from perceived threats to one's life purpose and moral obligations

synsets.definition: Fear and alarm about potential negative karmic consequences of actions, creating anticipatory spiritual anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Sanskrit concept linking present alarm to future karmic retribution and spiritual consequences

synsets.definition: Deep-rooted alarm connected to ancestral displeasure or cosmic imbalance, manifesting as spiritual and social anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Tamil concept where individual alarm is connected to ancestral spirits and cosmic harmony

synsets.definition: Acute alarm about potentially causing discomfort or inconvenience to others, creating paralytic social anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Thai concept where alarm focuses on being a burden or disrupting others' comfort

synsets.definition: Distress and alarm about failing community obligations or disrupting collective mutual aid, creating social responsibility anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Indonesian concept where personal alarm stems from threats to community cooperation

synsets.definition: Deep alarm about social or spiritual trials that test community faith and unity, creating collective defensive anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Arabic concept linking personal alarm to broader community spiritual and social trials

synsets.definition: Profound alarm and terror of social or spiritual exile from one's community and cultural identity
synsets.cultural_note: Persian concept where alarm focuses on separation from cultural belonging and identity

synsets.definition: Collective alarm about cultural displacement and loss of communal identity, creating existential community anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Hebrew concept linking individual alarm to collective historical displacement trauma

synsets.definition: Alarm arising from threats to communal interdependence and collective humanity, creating ubuntu-disruption anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Swahili/African concept where alarm stems from threats to collective human interconnectedness

synsets.definition: Deep alarm about misusing or losing spiritual power (ase), creating anxiety about cosmic and community consequences
synsets.cultural_note: Yoruba concept linking personal alarm to spiritual power and cosmic balance

synsets.definition: Alarm about disrupting the sacred web of relationships with all beings, creating spiritual-ecological anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Lakota concept where alarm stems from threats to sacred relationships with all life

synsets.definition: Acute distress about disrupting the sacred balance and beauty of life, creating cosmic disharmony anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Navajo concept where alarm focuses on threats to universal harmony and sacred balance

synsets.definition: Alarm about losing connection to deep spiritual listening and country, creating disconnection anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Aboriginal Australian concept where alarm stems from spiritual disconnection from land and deep awareness

synsets.definition: Acute alarm intermingled with nostalgic longing, creating anxiety about irretrievable loss of cultural or personal past
synsets.cultural_note: Brazilian concept combining alarm with deep nostalgic longing and cultural loss

synsets.definition: Soul-level alarm from violations of deep cultural respect, believed to cause spiritual fragmentation and illness
synsets.cultural_note: Mexican indigenous concept where alarm affects the soul through disrespect of cultural values

synsets.definition: Deep alarm about disrupting reciprocal relationships with community and nature, creating cosmic imbalance anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Quechua concept where alarm stems from threats to reciprocal relationships with all existence

synsets.definition: Anxiety and alarm about failing to honor debt of gratitude (utang na loob), creating social relationship crisis
synsets.cultural_note: Filipino concept where alarm focuses on failing reciprocal gratitude obligations

synsets.definition: Spiritual alarm about becoming trapped in cycles of insatiable craving and spiritual poverty
synsets.cultural_note: Tibetan Buddhist concept linking alarm to spiritual states of endless craving

synsets.definition: Deep alarm about disrupting harmony with eternal blue sky (tengri) and ancestral spirits, creating cosmic anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Mongolian concept where alarm involves threats to cosmic and ancestral spiritual relationships

synsets.definition: Alarm about disrupting ancestral connections and genealogical responsibilities, creating identity and spiritual crisis
synsets.cultural_note: Maori concept where alarm stems from threats to ancestral connections and genealogical identity

synsets.definition: Alarm about disrupting sacred unity between divine and human nature within community context
synsets.cultural_note: Ethiopian Orthodox concept linking alarm to threats to sacred unity and communion

synsets.definition: Alarm about losing connection with helping spirits and ancestral guidance, creating spiritual vulnerability anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Inuit concept where alarm involves threats to spiritual protection and ancestral guidance
